programme.title: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!
programme.desc: Incompetent detective Frank Drebin has to foil an attempt to assassinate the Queen as he woos Priscilla Presley.

programme.title: Waynes World
programme.desc: From Waynes basement, Wayne and Garth broadcast a talk-show called "Waynes World" on local public access television. The show comes to the attention of a sleazy network executive who wants to produce a big-budget version of "Waynes World"-and he also wants Waynes girlfriend, a rock singer named Cassandra. Wayne and Garth have to battle the executive not only to save their show, but also Cassandra.

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: The thriller that scared movie fans everywhere out of the water. Three men undertake a perilous journey to hunt down a great white killer shark.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Cop III
programme.desc: Detroit cop Axel Foley who returns to Beverly Hills, this time to track down bad guys at an amusement park. Judge Reinhold and Bronson Pinchot are also back for this third instalment.

programme.title: Field of Dreams
programme.desc: After a voice tells a farmer to put a baseball diamond in his cornfield, the ghosts of famous players begin to appear on it.

programme.title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
programme.desc: Power company repairman Roy Neary witnesses unidentified flying objects in the skies near his Muncie, Indiana home. The encounter sets into action a startling chain of dramatic events. Trying desperately to understand what he has seen, Neary is increasingly driven to the emotional edge by the governmental cover up thats blocking him. With his wife struggling in vain to understand what is happening as their relationship disintegrates, Neary finds an ally in Jillian Guiler, a woman who has also witnessed nocturnal encounters and whose young son has been abducted by the alien visitors. As Roy and Jillian look for an answer to the extraordinary mystery that has engulfed them, an international team of scientists led by Claude Lacombe, a dedicated French expert on extraordinary phenomena, also pursues the truth. As Lacombe and company seek to understand the phenomenon of the skies and look for a communications break-through, their cosmic detective work reaches from the Indiana plains across the world to a remote hillside in India and then to the one place that holds the answer in an ultimate close encounter.

programme.title: Gremlins
programme.desc: A hilarious, subversive and wickedly scary film about Gizmo the mogwai, a cuddly critter that multiplies with savage consequences. Great special effects and amazingly realistic mechanical creatures.

programme.desc: John takes Lyn and Luke to Kakadu where they raid nests and catch a four and a half metre male croc for research. Lyn returns to the place where her 11-year old granddaughter was taken by a croc and is finally at peace.

programme.title: Croc College

programme.title: The Parenting
programme.desc: Boyfriends Rohan and Josh plan a perfect weekend getaway in the country to introduce their parents. But as tensions begin to flare between the more traditional Sharon and Frank, and the laid-back Liddy and Cliff, the families soon realise that their rental, managed by eccentric local Brenda, is haunted by the presence of a 400-year-old poltergeist. When one parent becomes thoroughly possessed, its up to the young couple and their meddlesome BFF Sara to unite the families and stop the evil entity once and for all.

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire
programme.desc: The Spenglers return to the New York City firehouse where the original Ghostbusters have taken ghost-busting to the next level. When the discovery of an ancient artefact unleashes an evil force, Ghostbusters new and old must unite to save the world.

programme.title: And Mrs
programme.desc: When a reluctant bride-to-bes fiance drops dead, she insists on marrying him anyway, vowing to overcome public opinion, the law of the land, and her loved ones objections.

programme.title: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom
programme.desc: As Arthur Curry confronts the responsibilities of being King of the Seven Seas, a long-buried ancient power is unleashed. After witnessing the full effect of these dark forces, Aquaman must forge an uneasy alliance with an old enemy, and embark on a treacherous journey to protect his family, his kingdom, and the world from irreversible devastation.

programme.title: Something In The Water
programme.desc: A dream wedding turns into a nightmare when five girlfriends fight for their lives in open water.

programme.title: Saw X
programme.desc: A sick and desperate John Kramer travels to Mexico for a risky and experimental medical procedure in hopes of a miracle cure for his cancer - only to discover the entire operation is a scam to defraud the vulnerable. Armed with a newfound purpose, the infamous serial killer returns to his work, turning the tables on the con artists in his signature visceral way through devious, deranged, and ingenious traps.

programme.title: Smile 2
programme.desc: About to embark on a world tour, global pop sensation Skye Riley begins experiencing increasingly terrifying and inexplicable events. Overwhelmed by the escalating horrors and the pressures of fame, Skye is forced to face her past.

programme.title: Tarot
programme.desc: When a group of friends recklessly violates the sacred rule of Tarot readings, they unknowingly unleash an unspeakable evil trapped within the cursed cards. One by one, they come face to face with fate and end up in a race against death.

programme.title: The Beast Within
programme.desc: After witnessing her father undergo a terrible transformation, a 10-year-old girl becomes ensnared by the dark ancestral secret that her parents have so desperately tried to conceal.

programme.title: Night Swim
programme.desc: Former baseball player Ray Waller moves into a new home with his family. But a dark secret in the homes past will unleash a malevolent force that will drag the family into the depths of terror.

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: A curmudgeonly instructor at a prep school is forced to remain on campus during Christmas break to babysit a handful of students with nowhere to go.

programme.title: This Time Next Year
programme.desc: Minnie and Quinn are born on the same day, one minute apart. Their lives may begin together, but their worlds couldnt be more different. Years later they find themselves together again. Maybe its time to take a chance on love.

programme.title: Firebrand
programme.desc: Katherine Parr, Henry VIIIs sixth wife, becomes regent while he battles abroad. When he returns sick and paranoid, she must fight for her survival.

programme.title: Venom: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Eddie Brock and Venom must make a devastating decision as theyre pursued by a mysterious military man and alien monsters from Venoms home world.

programme.title: Bad Boys: Ride or Die
programme.desc: The worlds favourite Bad Boys are back with their iconic mix of edge-of-your seat action and outrageous comedy, but this time with a twist: Miamis finest are now on the run.

programme.title: Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga
programme.desc: As the world fell, young Furiosa is snatched from the Green Place of Many Mothers and falls into the hands of a great biker horde led by the warlord Dementus. Sweeping through the Wasteland, they come across the Citadel presided over by The Immortan Joe. While the two tyrants war for dominance, Furiosa must survive many trials as she puts together the means to find her way home.

programme.title: Mack and Rita
programme.desc: Mack is tired of doing all the things she has to do to keep up with her friends and become successful in her 30s. Her deepest wish is to be an older woman so she can just chill out and wear a good chunky sweater. But when shes struck by lightning in a sound bath regression pod at Coachella and becomes Rita, a 65-year-old woman, Mack learns that the reality of being an older age isnt quite what she imagined.

programme.title: Mean Girls (2024)
programme.desc: In a musical twist of the cult classic, new student Cady Heron is welcomed by the popular girls called "The Plastics". However, when Cady falls for queen bee Reginas ex-boyfriend, she finds herself in Reginas crosshairs. She must learn to stay true to herself while navigating the most cut throat jungle of all: high school.

programme.title: Wicked
programme.desc: In Oz, two clashing witches, Elphaba and Glinda, form an unlikely friendship. Elphaba, wrongly labeled wicked, seeks to expose the corrupt Wizard ruling the land.

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Torn apart from her sister Nettie and her children, Celie faces many hardships in her life, including an abusive husband simply called Mister. With the support of sultry singer Shug Avery and stand-her-ground stepdaughter Sofia, Celie ultimately finds extraordinary strength in the unbreakable bonds of a new kind of sisterhood.

programme.title: The Prince of Egypt: Live from the West End
programme.desc: A live stage recording of the musical based on DreamWorks Animations 1998 film adapted from the story of Moses, from his being a prince of Egypt to his ultimate destiny of leading the Children of Israel out of Egypt.

programme.title: The Heist Before Christmas
programme.desc: A Christmas-hating boy meets two Santas in the woods, one of whom claims to have fallen from his sleigh, but he is more interested in the other man when he learns he is on the run for robbing a bank.

programme.title: Watchmen: Chapter I
programme.desc: In an alternate world, the murder of a government sponsored superhero draws his outlawed colleagues out of retirement, into a mystery that threatens their lives and the world itself.

programme.title: Golda
programme.desc: Set during the tense 19 days of the Yom Kippur War in 1973. Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir is faced with the potential of Israels complete destruction, and must navigate overwhelming odds, a skeptical cabinet, and a complex relationship with US Secretary of State Henry Kissinger. Her tough leadership and compassion would ultimately decide the fate of her nation and leave her with a controversial legacy around the world.

programme.title: Reagan
programme.desc: From the glitter of Hollywood to the world stage, Ronald Reagan overcomes the odds to become the 40th president of the United States.

programme.title: Rumours
programme.desc: Leaders of the wealthiest democracies face absurd challenges as night falls in misty woods, realising they are suddenly alone and struggling with their incompetence.

programme.title: It Ends with Us
programme.desc: Lily overcomes a traumatic childhood to embark on a new life. A meeting with a neurosurgeon sparks a connection but Lily begins to see sides of him that remind her of her parents relationship.

programme.title: Wicked
programme.desc: In Oz, two clashing witches, Elphaba and Glinda, form an unlikely friendship. Elphaba, wrongly labeled wicked, seeks to expose the corrupt Wizard ruling the land.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.sub-title: Welch and Bastian - Mystery In The Parks
programme.desc: In Tacoma, Washington State, in 1986, 12-year-old Michella Welch goes missing in Puget Park. That night, police locate her badly bludgeoned body and there is evidence of sexual assault.

programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: When 26-year-old Wendy Mann is discovered strangled in her own home in August 2015, the police immediately suspect her married lover. However, while he is in custody held on suspicion of her murder, a tangled web of lies is uncovered, and the real killer is revealed.

programme.title: Click For Murder
programme.desc: Chilling series reveals disturbing crimes in recent history where the internet has been used to trick, torture, and kill victims lured from a virtual world.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia
programme.sub-title: A Killer Amongst Us - The Norfolk Island Murder
programme.desc: On Easter Sunday, 2002, on sleepy Norfolk Island in the south west Pacific, the body of 29-year-old Janelle Patton was found lying in an open field. Shed been stabbed to death in a frenzied attack that had left more than 60 wounds from her head to her feet. She had multiple bruises and broken bones and it was clear she had bravely fought back against a sustained attack. Glass fragments in her hair indicated she had been bashed around the head with a wine bottle. Although her clothes had been neatly cut away from her body, there was no evidence that she had been raped. The killing made news around the world. It was the first murder in more than a hundred years on an island famous for its history as a brutal penal colony and as home to the descendants of the notorious Bounty mutineers. With just 2771 residents and visitors on the island at the time, it was widely expected that the killer would be quickly identified and brought to justice.

programme.title: #textmewhenyougethome
programme.desc: #TextMeWhenYouGetHome became a viral, worldwide movement following the 2021 death of Sarah Everard. The slogan sparked awareness around the vulnerability women feel while out in public alone.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: In Dallas, a man is shot to death while trying to protect a friend outside a crowded nightclub. With little physical evidence to go on, Detective Robert Quirk must convince reluctant witnesses to tell him who pulled the trigger. In Detroit, a warm spring day turns deadly when a basketball game erupts in violence. To discover who fired the fatal shot, its up to officer Jo Ann Miller to track down the players one by one.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.sub-title: Pamela Cahanes - Murder By The Base
programme.desc: In Sanford, Florida, in 1984, the bruised and bloodied body of 25-year-old naval recruit Pamela Cahanes is found in an abandoned lot near the Naval Training Center.

programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: When the police are called to a house fire in June 2009, arson is quickly suspected. All four children in the Masud family are critically injured but daughters Maleha and Nabitha succumb to their injuries. The local community is shocked even more, when a 14-year-old boy is arrested and charged with murder.

programme.title: Cops Reloaded
programme.desc: Cops Reloaded revisits some of the most memorable suspects, car chases and action-packed moments from televisions popular reality program.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: Cant Tell You How To Live
programme.desc: Television cameras follow real-life law enforcement officers and capture the action as they perform their daily duty to serve and protect the public.

programme.title: Booked: First Day In
programme.desc: Follows arrested individuals through Americas booking process, offering an extraordinary look at the most unusual, bizarre and often tense bookings. Every day in America around 25,000 people are arrested and booked into jail, each one-hour episode will follow the story of an arrestee, with their permission, as they move through the system and recount what ultimately led them to their time in jail. From petty offences to serious crimes, viewers will be taken on a harrowing adventure while they watch the arrestees throughout the booking process.

programme.title: Hoarders
programme.desc: From the outside their houses look normal. But inside a family is struggling to keep ahead of the insignificant things that have taken over their lives.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain
programme.desc: In 1991 newly qualified nurse, Beverley Allitt, carried out despicable crimes. Instead of caring for children on her ward, she was murdering them. In 1993 after months of detective work she was convicted of killing four children and severely injuring a further nine. To most parents and colleagues she appeared helpful and friendly. But once left alone with the patients she murdered babies and children through fatal injections or suffocation. Child after child was collapsing on the ward but none of the staff could understand why.

programme.title: Booked: First Day In
programme.desc: Follows arrested individuals through Americas booking process, offering an extraordinary look at the most unusual, bizarre and often tense bookings. Every day in America around 25,000 people are arrested and booked into jail, each one-hour episode will follow the story of an arrestee, with their permission, as they move through the system and recount what ultimately led them to their time in jail. programme.title: Hoarders
programme.desc: From the outside their houses look normal. But inside a family is struggling to keep ahead of the insignificant things that have taken over their lives.

programme.title: I Survived a Crime
programme.desc: A mother and child are hit by a driver. A shopper is attacked by a customer but store employees jump in to help. A woman walking her dog faces off against purse snatchers; and more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police determine that the human remains found in a discarded box belong to one Edna Posey. But to find out when the murder took place, and whether the man accused of the crime is guilty, investigators turn to insects and the forensic entomologist who can interpret their behaviour.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 12-year-old girl claimed she had been abducted and sexually assaulted. She recounted what happened in such a flat, unemotional voice that police found it difficult to believe her. Fibres on her clothing would prove she was telling the truth, and help police to find her attacker.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In this international case of extortion, murder, and stolen identities, a Canadian financier assumes the name of a co-worker as part of a money-laundering scheme. programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a respected heart surgeon is found dead in the basement of his upscale Cincinnati home, police assume he committed suicide. Friends and family indicate that the man suffered prolonged bouts of depression and had spoken of killing himself. But a further investigation reveals that his new wife has a history of violence and an insatiable desire for money. The story of how he died is finally decided in court, as teams of forensic scientists face-off to see if the good doctor died at his own hand or was killed by his gold-digging wife.

programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: When 26-year-old Wendy Mann is discovered strangled in her own home in August 2015, the police immediately suspect her married lover. However, while he is in custody held on suspicion of her murder, a tangled web of lies is uncovered, and the real killer is revealed.

programme.title: Click For Murder
programme.desc: Chilling series reveals disturbing crimes in recent history where the internet has been used to trick, torture, and kill victims lured from a virtual world.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia
programme.sub-title: A Killer Amongst Us - The Norfolk Island Murder
programme.desc: On Easter Sunday, 2002, on sleepy Norfolk Island in the south west Pacific, the body of 29-year-old Janelle Patton was found lying in an open field. Shed been stabbed to death in a frenzied attack that had left more than 60 wounds from her head to her feet. She had multiple bruises and broken bones and it was clear she had bravely fought back against a sustained attack. Glass fragments in her hair indicated she had been bashed around the head with a wine bottle. Although her clothes had been neatly cut away from her body, there was no evidence that she had been raped. The killing made news around the world. It was the first murder in more than a hundred years on an island famous for its history as a brutal penal colony and as home to the descendants of the notorious Bounty mutineers. With just 2771 residents and visitors on the island at the time, it was widely expected that the killer would be quickly identified and brought to justice.

programme.title: #textmewhenyougethome
programme.desc: #TextMeWhenYouGetHome became a viral, worldwide movement following the 2021 death of Sarah Everard. The slogan sparked awareness around the vulnerability women feel while out in public alone.

programme.title: Dogfights
programme.desc: The sound of jet combat reverberates above the tombs of the Pharaohs as the small Israeli Air Force delivers a knockout punch to the Egyptians in the 1967 Six Day War. Fly in the Mirage III with the IAFs first jet ace Giora Romm as he chases down two MIG-17s over the Suez Canal at dusk. Be in the cockpit with 119 Squadron Commander and ace Ran Ronen as he flies into hostile Jordan for a top-secret rendezvous - arranged by the Israeli Mossad - and later as he speeds deep into enemy territory for a bombing mission that ends up as a swirling dogfight directly over the Egyptian base. Witness the first combat engagement of the McDonnell Douglas F-15 and how Major Moshe Melnik draws first blood for the Eagle in the skies over Lebanon in 1979. Learn how the Israeli Air Force of today hones its capabilities with cutting-edge technology that makes it the most feared opposition in the sky.

programme.title: Massive Engineering Mistakes
programme.desc: In Sweden, tragedy strikes as a landmark bridge is destroyed in seconds. A massive construction disaster occurs at a New Jersey casino. Unanticipated turbulence forces a rethink for Chicagos newest skyscraper.

programme.title: Hitlers Handmaidens
programme.desc: Explores how women are active and often violent participants and perpetrators in the war and its attendant atrocities, specially the Holocaust.

programme.title: Line of Fire
programme.desc: Persias commanders are known to have at first completely underestimated the Greek Hoplite warriors during the Greek-Persian wars. At Marathon in the year 490BC they were to be punished for their mistake. This episode also looks into the facts behind the great battles at Thermopylae and Salamis - defining moments in a war that saw an eventual Greek victory.

programme.title: Dogfights
programme.desc: Courageous bomber pilots from World War II and Vietnam challenge deadly foes - against incredible odds! Using state-of-the-art computer animation, youre in the cockpit with legendary WWII Navy ace Swede Vejtasas SBD dive bomber as he fights off eight lethal Japanese Zeroe. WWII medal of honour winner Jay Zeamer and his crew pit their slow B-17 bomber against 17 Japanese fighters in a 45-minute battle for survival. Plus, soar with Air Force Lt Col Leo Thorsness as his F-105 Thunderchief takes on a flight of skilled MiG-17s in the skies over Vietnam.

programme.title: Secrets of World War II
programme.desc: It was faster than any British battleship, but in what was to become known as The Battle of the North Cape, the Scharnhorst was about to meet its destiny at the hands of Admiral Fraser in one of the most exciting naval engagements ever.

programme.title: History of Warfare
programme.desc: After months of rising tension, The English Civil War finally exploded into life on the slopes of Edgehill on October 23, 1642. It was to be a confused and bitter business, marked by the foolishness of Prince Rupert and the Royalist cavalry, who left the field at a crucial stage of the battle. As darkness fell, nearly 3000 men lay dead and the die was cast: the English Civil War would be no short and decisive affair.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: A team of specialists dig deep to uncover as much as they can in three days about a UK sites archaeology and history.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: Secrets In the Ice is a one-hour factual series that goes to the most remote, cold, and inhospitable places on the planet to reveal great mysteries that were once frozen in time.

programme.title: Field of Vampires
programme.desc: Documents a forensic investigation of ancient skeletons in mysterious graveyards, ground-breaking DNA analysis, and pioneering facial reconstruction techniques.

programme.title: The Last Journey of the Vikings
programme.desc: For most people, Vikings are known only as violent looters, infamous for their swift and brutal raids as they plundered the European coasts for gold and silver. But in this series we will dig deeper and gain more insight into who the Vikings really were.

programme.title: Ancient Apocalypse
programme.desc: The Minoans, considered by many as the first European civilisation, flourished in the islands of the Aegean in the 3rd and 2nd millennia BCE, before eventually disappearing around 1100 BC.

programme.title: Ancient Black Ops
programme.desc: These stone age special forces of the Pacific invented their own martial art, Lua, in which they learned how to snap fingers and break shoulders. In the 18th century, led by their commander Kamehameha, one group of Koa defeated the modern technology of Captain Cook and a band of British marines.

programme.title: The World from Above
programme.sub-title: North Carolina USA - Corolla To New Bern
programme.desc: A breathtaking series of aerial programs offering an entirely different view of the world. From 10,000 feet down to just a few feet above ground, discover new perspectives through thrilling journeys, from mountains and great cities to fantastic castles and the great natural wonders of the globe. This series travels everywhere from Spain to South Africa, from the north of Iceland to North Carolina in the USA.

programme.title: The World from Above
programme.sub-title: New Hampshire USA - Isles Of Shoals To Dartmouth College
programme.desc: A breathtaking series of aerial programs offering an entirely different view of the world. From 10,000 feet down to just a few feet above ground, discover new perspectives through thrilling journeys, from mountains and great cities to fantastic castles and the great natural wonders of the globe. This series travels everywhere from Spain to South Africa, from the north of Iceland to North Carolina in the USA.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Appealing to history buffs and dedicated ramblers alike, Sir Tony Robinson embarks on more walks through some of Britains most spectacular and historic landscapes in search of the richest stories from Britains past. In each program, Tony follows a bespoke route that allows him to explore on foot both the history of a particularly colourful period or event and the spectacular landscape in which those events unfolded. With experts he encounters on the way, Tony reveals and discovers places that ordinary walkers and ramblers might otherwise miss. And he infuses each walk with an appreciation of some of the striking landscapes and geographical features he encounters.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Appealing to history buffs and dedicated ramblers alike, Sir Tony Robinson embarks on spectacular walks through some of Britains most historic landscapes in search of the richest stories from Britains past. In each programme, Tony follows a bespoke route that allows him to explore on foot both the history of a particularly colourful historical period or event, and the spectacular landscape in which those events unfolded. The walks are proper expeditions with each one taking Tony several days. With various experts he encounters on the way, Tony reveals and discovers places and their hidden stories that ordinary walkers and ramblers might otherwise miss. And, as well as the history, Tony infuses each walk with an appreciation of some of the striking landscapes and geographical features Britain contains.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: A team of specialists dig deep to uncover as much as they can in three days about a UK sites archaeology and history.

programme.title: Forsaken Places
programme.desc: Three relics of a fallen empire, three monuments of a time when half the world live under the shadow of the Hammer and Sickle. To this day, people can find traces left by the Soviet Union wherever they go.

programme.title: Fortress Britain
programme.desc: Alice and fellow historians tell the story of Henry VIIIs fear of invasion from Catholic Europe through physical reminders, including mighty castles and cannons, that survive to this day.

programme.title: A Mediterranean Military Jewel
programme.desc: In the south of Corsica stands a rocky spur of spectacular dimensions: the citadel of Bonifacio, situated at nearly 60 meters above the sea level.

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Andy and Paul travel to Nevada and investigate Mt. Wilson, a property once owned by Robert Bigelow and thought to contain mysterious tunnels that lead to a buried UFO.

programme.title: Amerigo Vespucci - Forgotten Namesake Of
programme.desc: Vespucci is a banker and is sent to Seville in 1491 to work for a banking house. The film refutes that Vespucci is an imposter and explains why America is rightly named after him.

programme.title: The Australian SAS: The Untold History
programme.desc: In Vietnam, the SAS attacks the Viet Cong infrastructure, and plays the savage Viet Cong at their own game - terrorising and demoralising the jungle enemy. But after Tet, anti-war Western politics frustrate the SAS.

programme.desc: Alice and fellow historians tell the story of Henry VIIIs fear of invasion from Catholic Europe through physical reminders, including mighty castles and cannons, that survive to this day.

programme.title: Planet of Treasures
programme.desc: In this episode of Planet of Treasures presenter Christopher Clark travels the African continent, known as the cradle of humankind. His journey leads him to Egypt with its ancient pyramids and temples, followed by the churches, fortresses and palaces of Ethiopia, to Tanzania with its breathtaking Serengeti National Park and to the historic Lamu Island off the coast of Kenya.

programme.title: The Brief History Of Cricket Downunder
programme.desc: Explore Australias sporting fortresses, delve into stories of their distinctive, sometimes unplayable wickets, antagonistic crowds and harsh climates. Meet the iconic batsmen and bowlers, heroic captains, and observe on-field antics ranging from poor behaviour to instances of brilliance and sportsmanship.

programme.title: The Brief History Of Cricket Downunder
programme.desc: Explore Australias sporting fortresses, delve into stories of their distinctive, sometimes unplayable wickets, antagonistic crowds and harsh climates. Meet the iconic batsmen and bowlers, heroic captains, and observe on-field antics ranging from poor behaviour to instances of brilliance and sportsmanship.

programme.title: Dogfights
programme.desc: The sound of jet combat reverberates above the tombs of the Pharaohs as the small Israeli Air Force delivers a knockout punch to the Egyptians in the 1967 Six Day War. Fly in the Mirage III with the IAFs first jet ace Giora Romm as he chases down two MIG-17s over the Suez Canal at dusk. Be in the cockpit with 119 Squadron Commander and ace Ran Ronen as he flies into hostile Jordan for a top-secret rendezvous - arranged by the Israeli Mossad - and later as he speeds deep into enemy territory for a bombing mission that ends up as a swirling dogfight directly over the Egyptian base. Witness the first combat engagement of the McDonnell Douglas F-15 and how Major Moshe Melnik draws first blood for the Eagle in the skies over Lebanon in 1979. Learn how the Israeli Air Force of today hones its capabilities with cutting-edge technology that makes it the most feared opposition in the sky.

programme.title: Massive Engineering Mistakes
programme.desc: In Sweden, tragedy strikes as a landmark bridge is destroyed in seconds. A massive construction disaster occurs at a New Jersey casino. Unanticipated turbulence forces a rethink for Chicagos newest skyscraper.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: A team of specialists dig deep to uncover as much as they can in three days about a UK sites archaeology and history.

programme.title: Fortress Britain
programme.desc: Alice and fellow historians tell the story of Henry VIIIs fear of invasion from Catholic Europe through physical reminders, including mighty castles and cannons, that survive to this day.

programme.title: A Mediterranean Military Jewel
programme.desc: In the south of Corsica stands a rocky spur of spectacular dimensions: the citadel of Bonifacio, situated at nearly 60 meters above the sea level.

programme.title: Beyond Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Andy and Paul travel to Nevada and investigate Mt. Wilson, a property once owned by Robert Bigelow and thought to contain mysterious tunnels that lead to a buried UFO.

programme.title: Amerigo Vespucci - Forgotten Namesake Of
programme.desc: Vespucci is a banker and is sent to Seville in 1491 to work for a banking house. The film refutes that Vespucci is an imposter and explains why America is rightly named after him.

programme.title: The Australian SAS: The Untold History
programme.desc: In Vietnam, the SAS attacks the Viet Cong infrastructure, and plays the savage Viet Cong at their own game - terrorising and demoralising the jungle enemy. But after Tet, anti-war Western politics frustrate the SAS.

programme.title: Planet of Treasures
programme.desc: In this episode of Planet of Treasures presenter Christopher Clark travels the African continent, known as the cradle of humankind. His journey leads him to Egypt with its ancient pyramids and temples, followed by the churches, fortresses and palaces of Ethiopia, to Tanzania with its breathtaking Serengeti National Park and to the historic Lamu Island off the coast of Kenya.

programme.title: The Brief History Of Cricket Downunder
programme.desc: Explore Australias sporting fortresses, delve into stories of their distinctive, sometimes unplayable wickets, antagonistic crowds and harsh climates. Meet the iconic batsmen and bowlers, heroic captains, and observe on-field antics ranging from poor behaviour to instances of brilliance and sportsmanship.

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.sub-title: Back To The Clinic Part 2 Revisit
programme.desc: In tonights show we revisit John who first came to the clinic with a severe case of anal abscesses. After 15 operations on his anus we see him undergo his final operation and hes coming back to the clinic to let Dr Pixie know if hes now seen the end to his problem. The doctors are also joined by a young lady who had a breast deformity which was taking over her life, a child with a severe infestation of headlice and we find out if a baby who had a serious hip operation is now able to walk. We also revisit Patricia from our Oldies special who was given revolutionary treatment for her bunions, is she now taking steps in the right direction?

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.sub-title: Back To The Clinic Part 3 Revisit
programme.desc: In tonights show we revisit Josh who came to the clinic after suffering from night terrors which were making him talk and shout obscenities in his sleep causing severe sleep deprivation to himself and his distressed wife. With their relationship on the rocks Josh underwent treatment at a sleep clinic and is coming back to the clinic to let Dr Dawn how he and his long suffering wife have been getting on since his treatment. We also revisit Elizabeth who underwent surgery to remove her rotten toenail, we catch up with Lois who suffered for years from persistent thrush. After a series of tests after the programme she was diagnosed with a thyroid problem. Dr Christian also catches up with Brian who came to see him with leaking bowels. After a change of diet and lifestyle we find out if Brian has managed to wipe out his problem for good and we catch up with Barry who underwent surgery for Prostate cancer. The doctors also delve into the world of labia shape and size and use the Embarrassing Bodies website to show worried females that there really is nothing to worry about.

programme.title: Neighbourhood Wars
programme.desc: With a record number of Americans trading city life for homes in the suburbs, relationships between neighbours are being put to the test. Each half-hour episode of "Neighbourhood Wars" takes viewers into the homes and backyards of neighbours across the country with some of the most unexpected and emotionally charged events caught on camera. Featuring footage from cell phones, drones, home security cameras and more, the series showcases the kindness and conflict between real-life neighbours throughout the US.

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Presented by Nick Knowles, this series brings to life the stories of ordinary people who have faced extraordinary circumstances - emergencies, accidents and incidents. With access to a variety of sources such as video and phone footage shot by the victims and onlookers, dramatic real-life 999 calls, and first-hand accounts from the victims and their friends and families, Close Calls: On Camera relives the split-second moments when everyday events are transformed into disasters and meets the people who lived to tell the tale. Watch the terrifying moment that a mother and her two children are suddenly faced with a life-threatening decision when their car starts burning uncontrollably in a Safari Park lion enclosure, or witness when a day of skiing takes a terrifying turn for three friends, after one of them misjudges the track and disappears into a bottomless crack in the ice.

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies
programme.sub-title: Back To The Clinic Part 3 Revisit
programme.desc: In tonights show we revisit Josh who came to the clinic after suffering from night terrors which were making him talk and shout obscenities in his sleep causing severe sleep deprivation to himself and his distressed wife. With their relationship on the rocks Josh underwent treatment at a sleep clinic and is coming back to the clinic to let Dr Dawn how he and his long suffering wife have been getting on since his treatment. We also revisit Elizabeth who underwent surgery to remove her rotten toenail, we catch up with Lois who suffered for years from persistent thrush. After a series of tests after the programme she was diagnosed with a thyroid problem. Dr Christian also catches up with Brian who came to see him with leaking bowels. After a change of diet and lifestyle we find out if Brian has managed to wipe out his problem for good and we catch up with Barry who underwent surgery for Prostate cancer. The doctors also delve into the world of labia shape and size and use the Embarrassing Bodies website to show worried females that there really is nothing to worry about.

programme.title: Neighbourhood Wars
programme.desc: With a record number of Americans trading city life for homes in the suburbs, relationships between neighbours are being put to the test. Each half-hour episode of "Neighbourhood Wars" takes viewers into the homes and backyards of neighbours across the country with some of the most unexpected and emotionally charged events caught on camera. Featuring footage from cell phones, drones, home security cameras and more, the series showcases the kindness and conflict between real-life neighbours throughout the US.

programme.title: Worlds Deadliest Weather: On Camera

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Presented by Nick Knowles, this series brings to life the stories of ordinary people who have faced extraordinary circumstances - emergencies, accidents and incidents. With access to a variety of sources such as video and phone footage shot by the victims and onlookers, dramatic real-life 999 calls, and first-hand accounts from the victims and their friends and families, Close Calls: On Camera relives the split-second moments when everyday events are transformed into disasters and meets the people who lived to tell the tale. Watch the terrifying moment that a mother and her two children are suddenly faced with a life-threatening decision when their car starts burning uncontrollably in a Safari Park lion enclosure, or witness when a day of skiing takes a terrifying turn for three friends, after one of them misjudges the track and disappears into a bottomless crack in the ice.

programme.title: Neighbourhood Wars
programme.desc: With a record number of Americans trading city life for homes in the suburbs, relationships between neighbours are being put to the test. Each half-hour episode of "Neighbourhood Wars" takes viewers into the homes and backyards of neighbours across the country with some of the most unexpected and emotionally charged events caught on camera. Featuring footage from cell phones, drones, home security cameras and more, the series showcases the kindness and conflict between real-life neighbours throughout the US.

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Presented by Nick Knowles, this series brings to life the stories of ordinary people who have faced extraordinary circumstances - emergencies, accidents and incidents. With access to a variety of sources such as video and phone footage shot by the victims and onlookers, dramatic real-life 999 calls, and first-hand accounts from the victims and their friends and families, Close Calls: On Camera relives the split-second moments when everyday events are transformed into disasters and meets the people who lived to tell the tale. Watch the terrifying moment that a mother and her two children are suddenly faced with a life-threatening decision when their car starts burning uncontrollably in a Safari Park lion enclosure, or witness when a day of skiing takes a terrifying turn for three friends, after one of them misjudges the track and disappears into a bottomless crack in the ice.

programme.title: Bridget Joness Baby
programme.desc: After breaking up with Mark Darcy, Bridget Joness "happily ever after" hasnt quite gone according to plan. Fortysomething and single again, she decides to focus on her job as top news producer and surround herself with old friends and new. For once, Bridget has everything completely under control. What could possibly go wrong? Then her love life takes a turn and Bridget meets a dashing American named Jack, the suitor who is everything Mr. Darcy is not. In an unlikely twist she finds herself pregnant, but with one hitch she can only be fifty percent sure of the identity of her babys father.

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: A sports agent suddenly discovers his scruples and promptly loses his job. But with the help of one loyal colleague and one outrageous client, he learns that loving well is the best revenge.

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: After discovering that retirement isnt all its cracked up to be, a 70-year-old widower seizes an opportunity to become a senior intern at an online fashion site.

programme.title: Pleasantville
programme.desc: Two modern American teenagers are sucked into their television set and end up living in a black-and-white 50s sitcom.

programme.title: 50 First Dates
programme.desc: Henry lives an enviable life in a Hawaiian paradise, spending every night with a beautiful tourist in search of an island fling. Its a sweet life with no strings attached until he meets Lucy. He and Lucy hit it off from the get-go, but the next day she acts like she doesnt know him. Has his karma come around to kick him in the butt or what? Actually, Lucy has short-term memory loss so every night all memory of her day is erased. But a man in love will go to any lengths to win over the girl of his dreams, and if that means having to find imaginative ways of doing it over again every day, then Henrys up for the challenge.

programme.title: Something to Talk About
programme.desc: A contemporary Southern wife and mother has the perfect life. But when she learns that her husband has been unfaithful, she steps back and examines her life from a new perspective.

programme.title: Notting Hill
programme.desc: Anna Scott is the worlds most famous movie star. Her picture has been plastered on the cover of every magazine, and every time she makes a movie, the entire world knows about it. William Thacker owns a travel bookstore in the quaint neighbourhood of Notting Hill. His business is stagnant, he has the roommate from hell and his love life is completely non-existent. Then one day, their paths cross and the couple comes to face the ultimate question: can two people fall in love with the whole world watching?

programme.title: A Cinderella Story
programme.desc: A student is controlled by her wicked stepmother and stepsisters, but her anonymous email buddy is a real Prince Charming. Will she turn into a pumpkin when they finally meet at the school dance?

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Jo March reflects back and forth on her life, telling the beloved story of the March sisters - four young women, each determined to live life on her own terms.

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Not that Bridgets counting, but its been six weeks, four days, and seven hours with flawless boyfriend, Mark Darcy.

programme.title: The Curious Case of Benjamin Button
programme.desc: "I was born under unusual circumstances." And so begins this film, adapted from the 1920s story by F. Scott Fitzgerald about a man who is born in his eighties and ages backwards: a man, like any of us, who is unable to stop time. Set in New Orleans, from the end of World War I in 1918 into the 21st century, we follow his journey that is as unusual as any mans life can be. This is a grand tale of a not-so-ordinary man and the people and places he discovers along the way, the loves he finds, the joys of life and the sadness of death, and what lasts beyond time.

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
programme.desc: After a man pours out his love for his late wife on radio, a listener inexplicably decides that he is her destiny and treks across the USA to meet him.

programme.title: Youve Got Mail
programme.desc: Two anonymous emailers fall head-over-laptops in love, unaware they are fierce rivals in the bookshop business.

programme.title: Youve Got Mail

programme.title: The Mirror Has Two Faces
programme.desc: Rose Morgan, who still lives with her mother, is a professor of Romantic Literature who desperately longs for passion in her life. Gregory Larkin, a mathematics professor, has been burned by passionate relationships and longs for a sexless union based on friendship and respect. Theyre two people with almost nothing in common, but fate in the form of a personal ad and a meddling sister brings them together. And without physical attraction to complicate matters, Rose and Greg become best friends and soon agree to an unconventional marriage built on intellectual passion instead of sexual heat. But when two people meet, marry, try to remain celibate and then fall in love they realise they are courting chaos.

programme.title: For Love Of The Game
programme.desc: When a legendary pitcher strikes out with his girlfriend, he has to play the game of his life. The suspense lasts until the last ball is thrown in this heartwarming drama.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility
programme.desc: Based on Jane Austens classic novel, this tells of the Dashwood sisters, sensible Elinor and passionate Marianne, whose chances at marriage seem doomed by their familys sudden loss of fortune. Rickman, Grant and Greg Wise co-star as the well-intentioned suitors who are trapped by the strict rules of society and the conflicting laws of desire.

programme.desc: Despite ever more staggering expectations, Tiger maintains his competitive dominance, while secretly navigating a double life. At the centre of that double life is Tigers ex-mistress who breaks her silence.

programme.title: Wentworth
programme.desc: Ferguson, having found protection in Kazs crew, cunningly blames Will for her brutal ganging, a move which only strengthens Kazs support for her. When Bea defends Will, it backfires dramatically. She is painted as a screw-lover, and rapidly begins to lose the support of the women. programme.title: Wentworth
programme.desc: With Bea in the slot, Ferguson intensifies her manipulation of Kaz. Seizing on the recent death of her father that sends Kaz into an inexplicable spiral, Ferguson realises that Kaz was a victim of abuse at his hands. Ferguson uses her own troubled relationship with her father as a means of forming a closer bond with Kaz. When new Indigenous inmate Tasha is put under Doreens care, Ferguson sees an opportunity to force Kaz into action against Bea. With Maxine as acting top dog, Ferguson places Tasha in Lucys orbit and when Tasha breaks the rules by protecting herself from Lucys molestation, Maxine appears to have no choice but to punish Tasha. Ferguson urges Kaz to stand up to Maxine and save the innocent girl from abuse at the hands of a man, thereby tapping into Kazs past trauma. Bea and Allys bond is cemented when they are slotted in adjoining cells and spend hours talking.
